intro: Desmos sessiliflorus, commonly known as the sessile-flower desmos, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and small, ovate leaves. Its flowers are usually greenish-white in color and are borne on short pedicels. Desmos sessiliflorus is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
